file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 24-36-01-04 - MAIN BATTERY - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL MAIN BATTERY - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedure to remove/install the main batteries. B. There are two main batteries. The main batteries are installed on the left side of forward fuselage section I. C. You can get access to the main batteries through access door 113DL on the left side of forward fuselage section I. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 24-36-01-000-801-A MAIN BATTERY - REMOVAL ALL 24-36-01-400-801-A MAIN BATTERY - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 24-36-01 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 24-36-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. MAIN BATTERY - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the main batteries. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 113 113DL - Main battery compartment door Forward fuselage section I D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY To help you to lift the main battery from/to GSE 055 Battery Lift the main battery compartment E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task LH Forward fuselage section I I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the GPU pushbutton, on the electrical panel, installed on the overhead panel, is set at OFF (the striped bar is off). (2) Attach a DO-NOT-SET-TO-ON tag to the GPU pushbutton. (3) Make sure that the BATT 1 and BATT 2 switches, on the electrical panel, installed on the overhead panel, are set at OFF. (4) Attach a DO-NOT-SET-TO-AUTO tag to the BATT 1 and BATT 2 switches. (5) Open main battery compartment door 113DL (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 24-36-01 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Loosen the clamp (7) of the front ventilation hose (8). (2) Disconnect the front ventilation hose (8) from the main battery (1). (3) Disconnect the clamps (9) that hold the power connector cables of the main battery 1. (4) Cut the lockwire (11) from the power connector (12). (5) Disconnect the power connector (12) from the main battery (1). (6) To prevent damage to the power connector of main battery 1, do as follows, if you will remove only main battery 2: (a) Cut the lockwire (11) from the power connector (12) from the main battery 1. (b) Disconnect the power connector (12) from the main battery 1. (7) Disconnect the connector of the temperature sensors (6) from the main battery (1). (8) Loosen the self-locking retainers (10). (9) Loosen the clamp (2) of the upper ventilation hose (3). (10) Disconnect the upper ventilation hose (3) from the main battery (1). (11) Pull the main battery (1) to get access to the clamp (4) of the upper ventilation hose (5). (12) Loosen the clamp (4) of the upper ventilation hose (5). (13) Disconnect the upper ventilation hose (5) from the main battery (1). WARNING: THE BATTERY WEIGHT IS 37,0KG (81.571 LB). EMBRAER DOES NOT HAVE TECHNICAL OBJECTION TO THE PERFORMANCE OF THIS TASK WITHOUT GSE 055. BE VERY CAREFUL WHEN YOU MOVE OR LIFT THE BATTERY. IF YOU DO NOT OBEY THIS INSTRUCTIONS, INJURY TO PEOPLE AND/OR DAMAGE TO THE EQUIPMENT CAN OCCUR. (14) Use GSE 055 (Battery Lift) to remove the main battery (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 24-36-01 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Main Batteries - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A B BATTERY 2 5. UPPER B DET. A VENTILATION HOSE BATTERY 1 4. CLAMP 3. UPPER VENTILATION HOSE 2. CLAMP 6. CONNECTOR OF THE TEMPERATURE SENSORS 1. BATTERY 9. CLAMPS 12. POWER 7. CLAMP CONNECTOR 8. FRONT 10. SELF-LOCKING VENTILATION RETAINERS 11. LOCKWIRE HOSE DET. B EM145AMM240012C.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 24-36-01 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 24-36-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. MAIN BATTERY - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the main batteries. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM TASK 24-36-00-700-801-A/500 MAIN BATTERY SYSTEM - OPERATIONAL TEST C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 113 113DL - Main battery compartment door Forward fuselage section I D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY To help you to remove/install the main bat- GSE 055 Battery Lift tery from/to the main battery compartment E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) 400 ASTM B 134-(OS) Lockwire - Annealed Brass C26000, .012 in (mm) G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task LH Forward fuselage section I I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Connect the upper ventilation hose (5) to the main battery (1). (2) Tighten the clamp (4) of the upper ventilation hose (5). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 24-36-01 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL WARNING: THE BATTERY WEIGHT IS 37,0KG (81.571 LB). EMBRAER DOES NOT HAVE TECHNICAL OBJECTION TO THE PERFORMANCE OF THIS TASK WITHOUT GSE 055. BE VERY CAREFUL WHEN YOU MOVE OR LIFT THE BATTERY. IF YOU DO NOT OBEY THIS INSTRUCTIONS, INJURY TO PEOPLE AND/OR DAMAGE TO THE EQUIPMENT CAN OCCUR. (3) Use GSE 055 (Battery Lift) to put the main battery (1) back in the compartment. (4) Connect the upper ventilation hose (3) to the main battery (1). (5) Tighten the clamp (2) of the upper ventilation hose (3). (6) Push the main battery (1) into position. (7) Tighten the self-retainers (10). (8) Connect the front ventilation hose (8) to the main battery (1). (9) Tighten the clamp (7) of the front ventilation hose (8). (10) Connect the connector of the temperature sensors (6) to the main battery (1). (11) Connect the power connector (12) to the main battery (1). (12) Use a lockwire (11) to safety the power connector (12). (13) Connect the power connector (12) of the other main battery, if applicable. (14) Use a lockwire (11) to safety the power connector (12) of the other main battery, if applicable. (15) Connect the clamps (9) to hold the power connector cables of the main battery 1. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close main battery compartment door 113DL (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (2) Remove the DO-NOT-SET-TO-ON tag from the GPU pushbutton. (3) Remove the DO-NOT-SET-TO-AUTO tag from the BATT 1 and BATT 2 switches. (4) Do the operational test of the main battery system ( AMM TASK 24-36-00-700-801-A/ 500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 24-36-01 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
